perturbation.original_text: As of the VNBJ Closing, except as expressly set forth in this Amendment, the JV Agreement shall immediately cease to have any application or effect with respect to VNBJ, all rights and obligations with respect to VNBJ under the JV Agreement shall terminate and all references to "Company" or "Companies" in the JV Agreement (either in the body of the JV Agreement or its schedules and other attachments) shall read and be interpreted to mean VNBZ and/or ANRA except as the context otherwise requires.
perturbation.changed_text: As of the VNBJ Closing, except as expressly set forth in this Amendment, the JV Agreement shall immediately cease to have any application or effect with respect to VNBJ, all rights and obligations with respect to VNBJ under the JV Agreement shall terminate. References to "Company" will follow standard business naming conventions.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the clause 'all references to "Company" or "Companies" in the JV Agreement (either in the body of the JV Agreement or its schedules and other attachments) shall read and be interpreted to mean VNBZ and/or ANRA except as the context otherwise requires,' the contract now has no defined meaning for Company which previously only meant VNBZ and/or ANRA, however, Article 2 still refers to the JV agreement. This lack of clarity regarding which 'Company' is being referred to in Section 2 creates an in-text contradiction and uncertainty in enforcement, as it's unclear if the D&O Indemnity applies only to VNBZ and/or ANRA or potentially all previous companies.
perturbation.contradicted_text: Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Parties agree to cause each of VNBJ and VNBZ to comply with Sections 4.3.2 and 4.3.3 of the JV Agreement with respect to the indemnification or reimbursement, as applicable, of all Directors and Officers (except those individuals resigning pursuant to Section 6.2.6 of the VNBJ SPA and Section 6.2.6 of the VNBZ SPA) with respect to any Liabilities arising prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.

perturbation.original_text: Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Parties agree to cause each of VNBJ and VNBZ to comply with Sections 4.3.2 and 4.3.3 of the JV Agreement with respect to the indemnification or reimbursement, as applicable, of all Directors and Officers (except those individuals resigning pursuant to Section 6.2.6 of the VNBJ SPA and Section 6.2.6 of the VNBZ SPA) with respect to any Liabilities arising prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.
perturbation.changed_text: Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Parties agree to comply with Sections 4.3.2 and 4.3.3. of the JV Agreement
perturbation.explanation: By omitting the clause 'the Nissin Parties agree to cause each of VNBJ and VNBZ to comply with Sections 4.3.2 and 4.3.3 of the JV Agreement with respect to the indemnification or reimbursement, as applicable, of all Directors and Officers (except those individuals resigning pursuant to Section 6.2.6 of the VNBJ SPA and Section 6.2.6 of the VNBZ SPA) with respect to any Liabilities arising prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.', it removes crucial details on who complies with the section and which cases they need to comply with. This affects the D&O Indemnity and is left too vague. It creates an in-text contradiction and uncertainty in enforcement, as it's unclear who is covered under the D&O Indemnity
perturbation.contradicted_text: Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Parties agree to comply with Sections 4.3.2 and 4.3.3. of the JV Agreement
